newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spanish court upholds ban on pro-ETA rally.
newsitem.headline: Spanish court upholds ban on pro-ETA rally.

text.p: A Superior Court in Spain's Basque country said on Friday it was upholding a regional government ban on a demonstration called in support of the Basque rebel group ETA.

The Basque government prohibited the rally, planned for Saturday in San Sebastian, for fear it would provoke a violent backlash from people angered by ETA's killing of a young politician last weekend.
ETA's political wing Herri Batasuna said on Thursday it would call off the demonstration if the court upheld the government order.

The court said it would release a full statement on the ruling later on Friday. It will wait until Tuesday to make a decision about a second rally that Herri Batasuna has called for the following Sunday.

ETA, which is fighting for Basque independence, provoked unprecedented street protests when it carried out its threat to kill 29-year-old Miguel Angel Blanco last weekend, two days after kidnapping the town councillor.
An estimated six million Spaniards took to the streets to express their outrage. In some Basque towns, protesters burned Herri Batasuna offices and physically assaulted ETA supporters.
